Dear Mrs. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Jennifer Pastorick, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation 1. Two days ago, a staff member put the youth in a restraint
by pulling the right arm back and twisting it hard enough to
leave bruises. Another staff member also pulls and twists
the youth's arms hard enough that it hurts when restraining
the youth.
Additional Allegations:
2. Staff slapped youth in the face after being bite by youth.
Investigation Allegation 1:
Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
9/23/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A
reported he was restrained by Staff 1 and Staff 2 in the hallway of
the house and Staff 1 bent his arms back. Youth A described the
restraint as Staff 1 kneeling behind him and bending his arms
back in a handcuffed position. Staff 2 was present and watched.
Youth A reported no other youth witnessed the restraint. Youth A
reported he was restrained due to refusing to go to his bedroom.
Youth A reported he was resisting the restraint and hitting Staff 1
in the legs.
Youth A reported while he was on quest, Staff 1 grabbed him in
the middle of the night and threw him out the back door of the
2

cabin. Youth A reported Staff 1 asked him if he wanted to go
outside, and Youth A responded he did. Staff 1 picked Youth A up
and threw him out the back door. Youth A reported Youth B, Youth
C, and Staff 5 witnessed Staff 1 throw him out the back door.
Youth A reported he hit the ground after Staff 1 threw him.
Youth A reported Staff 2 also bent his arm back in a restraint a
few weeks ago in the hallway. Youth A described the restraint as
the facilities approved restraint model of being an Aegis
benevolent restraint. Youth A reported he did not recall the time
of day, any specific details of the restraint, and reported no other
staff or youth were present as witnesses.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
9/23/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B
reported he witnessed Youth A get restrained by Staff 1 and Staff
2 however was unable to recall when or where. Youth B reported
Youth A was restrained for hitting staff and he did not witness
Staff 1 or Staff 2 do anything to hurt Youth A during the restraint.
Youth B reported he has been restrained by Staff 1 and Staff 2
and has never been hurt.
Youth B reported Youth A was restrained at quest by Staff 1 as
Youth A was attempting to fight peers. Youth B reported Staff 1
threw Youth A out of the cabin by picking him up off the ground in
a hugging position and threw him out the door. Youth A landed on
his feet outside. Youth B reported Youth C, Youth D, and Staff 5
witnessed this. Youth A was not injured. Youth B did not recall
what happened after Staff 1 threw Youth A out of the cabin. Youth
B has never seen Staff 1 throw any other youth around at the
facility.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
9/23/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth C
reported he has seen Youth A be restrained before as well as
other youth at the facility and has never witnessed Youth A get
hurt during a restraint.
Youth C reported Youth A was restrained at quest outside the
cabin. Youth A was keeping other youth awake at bedtime as
Youth A was yelling and cussing at Staff 1. Youth C reported
Youth A threw himself on the ground near the door by his bed.
Youth C reported Staff 1 escorted Youth A out of the cabin and
demonstrated Staff 1 holding Youth A’s arms in the Aegis escort
technique. Youth C reported once outside Youth A ran way from
the cabin but returned.
3

Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
9/23/2024. Youth D reported Youth A was restrained while at
quest by Staff 1 however Youth D reported he did not want to talk
about it. Youth D reported he has been restrained while at the
facility and has witnessed restraints and has no concerns with
how restraints are performed.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
9/23/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1
reported Youth A was escalated on 9/16/2024 for most of the shift.
Youth A had been out of bounds, attempted to “mess with” Staff
2’s car, and was upset about evening snack. Youth A needed
insulin before his evening snack however became escalated and
began throwing items in the house. Staff 1 reported he went to
escort Youth A to his bedroom when Youth A dropped to the
ground and began spitting, attempting to bite him, kicked him in
the knee, and punched Staff 2. Staff 1 reported he placed Youth
A in a benevolent restraint. Youth A was held in the restraint for a
few minutes. Youth A calmed down and was released from the
restraint. Youth A got up from the restraint and began threatening
to fight staff. Staff 1 reported Youth A’s arm was already up in the
air which made it easy for him to get Youth A into the restraint.
Staff 1 reported Youth A did not struggle during the restraint and
Youth A never complained of being in any pain or hurt from the
restraint.
Staff 1 reported he was on quest with Youth A. Youth A was
restraint two to three times while on quest. Staff 1 reported Youth
A and Youth D were fighting. Staff 1 stepped in the middle of
Youth A and Youth D and escorted Youth A away. Staff 1
described the escort as one hand under Youth A’s armpit and his
other hand holding Youth A’s wrist. Staff 1 denied ever picking
Youth A up and throwing him out of the cabin. Staff 1 reported
Staff 5 was present and witnessed the escort. Staff 1 reported
Youth A was swearing one night at quest at bedtime, and he
offered Youth A to go for a walk. Staff 1 reported he walked
toward Youth A in his bed and Youth A did throw himself on the
floor. Staff 1 escorted Youth A out of the cabin.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
9/23/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2
reported Youth A has behaviors daily, including hitting staff, and
he did not recall any specifics regarding the restraint that occurred
in the hallway at the facility on 9/18/2024. Staff 2 reported he has
never had any concerns with the restraints Staff 1 has performed
4

at the facility. Staff 2 denied any youth ever sharing concerns with
him regarding Staff 1 causing pain during restraints. Staff 2
reported he was not at quest and did not have any knowledge of
any restraints that may have occurred.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on 10/4/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported he has
restrained Youth A due to Youth A being aggressive to others.
Staff 3 denied ever pulling Youth A’s arm back and twisting Youth
A’s arm in restraints. Staff 3 reported he was in a restraint with
Youth A in the hallway as Youth A was attempting to fight
someone however Staff 3 did not recall who. Staff 3 reported
Youth A was asked to take a break in his bedroom to calm down
and Youth A escalated and began trying to punch him. Staff 3
reported he placed Youth A in a benevolent restraint per the Aegis
technique. Staff 3 reported he recalled other staff being present
while he was in the restraint with Youth A however did not recall
who or when this restraint occurred. Staff 3 reported Youth A has
never made any statements to him about restraints hurting or ever
being hurt/injured in a restraint.
Staff 5 was interviewed via telephone on 9/26/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 5 reported she was at
quest. Staff 5 was in the cabin with Staff 1 until the youth fell
asleep at night. Staff 5 reported Youth A had difficulty with
bedtime as he would escalate and begin destroying items in the
cabin and was attempting to assault Youth D. Staff 1 escorted
Youth A out of the cabin. Staff 5 reported she remained in the
cabin with Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D. Staff 5 reported she
never witnessed or heard anything about Staff 1 picking Youth A
up and throwing him outside the cabin. Staff 5 reported Youth A
would begin screaming when Staff 1 would have him in an escort
as Youth A would scream Staff 1 was a predator. Staff 5 reported
she has never witnessed Staff 1 be physically inappropriate with
the youth. Staff 5 reported she typically debriefs with youth after
restraints. Staff 5 reported Youth A has told her that he does not
like Staff 1 and Staff 2 as they are typically the staff that restrain
him and he does not think he should be restrained. Youth A has
never provided any other information to Staff 5 to indicate Staff 1
or Staff 2 are hurting Youth A in anyway.
Staff 6 was interviewed via telephone on 9/26/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 6 reported he was at
quest however not in Youth A’s cabin. Staff 6 reported he never
heard anyone say Staff 1 threw Youth A out of the cabin.
5

Supervisor 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
9/23/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor 1
reported he was not aware of the restraint that occurred on
9/18/2024 with Youth A, Staff 1, and Staff 2. Supervisor 1 reported
he has not heard any complaints from youth regarding concerns
with restraints with Staff 1. Supervisor 1 heard Youth A once say
his arm was numb while in a restraint with Staff 3 due to the
benevolent restraint position having the one arm over the head
bent (part of the trained technique). Supervisor 1 did not recall
when this occurred. Supervisor 1 was not at quest and denied
hearing any concerns of Staff 1 throwing Youth A out of the cabin.
Supervisor 1 reported he heard Youth A attempted to stab Staff 1
with his insulin pen.
Therapist was interviewed via telephone on 9/26/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Therapist reported she
works individually with Youth A once a week. Youth A has not
shared any concerns with her regarding any staff at the facility
hurting him.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 9/18/2024 in the bedroom hallway was
viewed on 9/23/2024. Staff 2 stood at the end of the hallway. The
video cuts out so it is unclear exactly what leads to the incident.
When the video resumes Youth A was laying on the ground at the
end of the hallway with Staff 1 and Staff 2 standing near him. Staff
1 bends down and appeared to try to get Youth A into a sitting up
position. Staff 2 was holding Youth A’s arms up in the air. Youth A
appeared to be pulling his arms away from Staff 1 and Staff 2.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 maintain hold on Youth A’s arms and were
pulling Youth A’s arms as Youth A laid on the floor moving around.
Video footage of the entire incident is unclear as there was a chair
in the hallway that blocked the view of Youth A on the ground.
Youth A kicked at Staff 1. Staff 1 had his left-hand holding Youth
A’s wrist and his right hand under Youth A’s armpit. Youth A
appeared to be moving around as Staff 1 attempted to secure a
hold on Youth A. Youth A continued moving while lying on his
back on the floor. Staff 1 continued to try to secure Youth A. Staff
1 knelt down on one knee while attempting to secure Youth A’s
left arm. Staff 2 secured Youth A’s right arm by holding it straight
out. Youth A continued to resist the restraint and twist and turn his
body. Staff 1 lost grip on Youth A. Youth A turned his body
around. Staff 1 moved around to get behind Youth A. Staff 2
continued to hold Youth A’s right arm up in the air. Staff 1
continued to attempt to secure Youth A’s left arm in the
benevolent restraint. Staff 2 let go of Youth A’s right arm and Staff
6

1 secured Youth A in the restraint. It is unclear how Youth A and
Staff 1’s hands are in the restraint as Staff 1’s back is to the
camera and Youth A was in front of Staff 1. Youth A continued to
resist and struggle in the restraint. Staff 1 released Youth A and
stood up. Youth A remained on the floor in a seated position.
Youth A stood up. Staff 1 points his arm down the hall. Staff 1
grabs on to Youth A’s arm with his left hand near Youth A’s
forearm and right hand one the back of Youth A’s shoulder. Youth
A was standing next to the chair. Staff 1 appeared to pull Youth
A’s arm to get Youth A around the chair. Youth A moved around
the chair. Staff 1 had Youth A’s left arm secured behind his back
as Staff 1’s left hand was on Youth A’s upper shoulder area with
Youth A’s arm behind his back. Youth A walked toward the
bedroom as Staff 1 followed holding Youth A’s left arm out to the
side with Staff 1’s left hand secured on Youth A’s wrist area and
Staff 1’s right hand holding Youth A’s elbow area. Youth A goes
into his bedroom and Staff 1 lunges forward in a pushing motion
as he released Youth A’s left arm.
Allegation 2:
Interviews:
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
9/23/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth C
reported two to three months ago he bit Staff 4 on the arm and
Staff 4 slapped him in the face as a reflex to him biting her. Youth
C reported he punched Staff 4 for slapping him. Youth C reported
Staff 5 was present and witnessed Staff 4 slap him. Youth C
denied having a bruise or injury as a result of Staff 4 slapping him
on the face.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
9/23/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4
reported she has been bit by Youth C multiple times at the facility
in the forearm and shoulder when Youth C is escalated. Staff 4
reported there was one incident when Youth C bit her arm and
she went to push Youth C’s head away from her arm as a reflex
and she had her hand cupped, and her hand hit Youth C’s check.
Staff 4 reported she was not intentionally trying to slap Youth C.
Staff 4 reported Staff 5 was present. Staff 4 reported she
apologized to Youth C and informed him that it was a reflex
movement. Staff 4 notified Supervisor 2 and Youth C was
checked out by medical. Staff 4 reported the facility trains staff to
not get bit by youth however if a youth does bite the technique that
is supposed to be used is the bite release where a finger is used
to put pressure on the jaw muscle for the youth to release the bite.
Staff 4 reported she did not use the trained technique.
7

Staff 5 was interviewed via telephone on 9/26/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 5 reported Youth C
has bite Staff 4 multiple times. Staff 5 reported approximately four
months ago Youth C went out of bounds and Staff 5 was assisting
Staff 4 in deescalating Youth C. Staff 4, Staff 5, and Youth C
were walking on the trail back to the house and Youth C was
targeting his aggression towards Staff 4. Staff 5 reported she
turned her head and saw Staff 4 hit Youth C upside the head.
Staff 5 reported she pulled Youth C away from Staff 4 and sat on
the ground with him. Staff 5 reported she apologized to Youth C
for Staff 4 doing what she did as it was not ok. Staff 4 stepped
away and made a phone call. Staff 5 reported she emailed
Administrator about the incident.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed via telephone on 9/26/2024.
Supervisor 2 reported she was the on-call supervisor when Youth
C bit Staff 4. Supervisor 2 received a call from Staff 4 who was
crying. Staff 4 informed Supervisor 2 Youth C had bit her, and
she pushed his head away. Supervisor 2 reported Staff 4 was
crying and had remorse as Staff 4 was concerned Youth C could
have viewed the pushing of his head away as a slap. Supervisor
2 called and notified the Administration team, and it was decided
to move Staff 4 to another house at the facility for the night to
separate from Youth C. Supervisor 2 did not have any further
contact with Staff 4 regarding this situation as Supervisor 2 was
not Staff 4’s direct supervisor.
Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
9/23/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Administrator
reported Aegis model teaches a bite release method in the in-
class training which is to put a finger on the jaw muscle and place
pressure, so the youth release the bite. Administrator reported
Staff 4 notified Supervisor 2 who made Administrator aware of the
incident. Staff 4 was moved to another house as part of a safety
plan to address the incident.
Documents Reviewed:
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 195050238 dated 9/18/2024 for Youth A:
Youth A was dysregulated, Staff 1 and Staff 2 attempted to
deescalate Youth A. Youth A kicked Staff 1 in the knee
and attempted to punch Staff 2. Youth A was placed in a
benevolent restraint by Staff 1. The incident report does not
indicate where the restraint occurred.
8

• Eagle Village Residential Services Standard Operating
Procedures Therapeutic Holds: Benevolent Restraint: The
only approved therapeutic hold techniques are the methods
and techniques taught in the required Aegis course. If a
youth is physically harming themselves and/or others or
attempting to escape where the youth may be at risk of injury
to self or others and there are not two staff available to
intervene, then staff may utilize the Benevolent Restraint.
This is the only single staff hold Aegis identifies as an
appropriate one to one intervention. The Aegis – Voluntary
Assist’s primary use is to remove the physically acting out
youth away from the group so staff can continue verbal de-
escalation with that youth. The Voluntary Assist can be a
single staff intervention or a two staff intervention.
• Eagle Village Residential Services Policies and Procedures
Behavior Support and Management: Behavior support and
management is more than just managing the youths’ physical
behavior; it involves the entire treatment process to the end of
helping the youth manage their own behavior in a socially
healthy and respectful manner. Any staff member found using
unacceptable discipline practices will immediately be subject
to disciplinary action up to termination.
• Eagle Village Incident Report dated 6/16/2024 for Youth C:
Youth C bit Staff 4’s left forearm during an escort. Staff 4’s
initial reaction was to push Youth C’s head away with her other
hand causing Staff 4 to quickly swipe Youth C’s face.
• Eagle Village does not have a written policy or procedure that
addresses bite releases however it is trained in Aegis.
• Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3’s personnel file: There was no
disciplinary record for Staff 1, Staff 2, or Staff 3. Staff 1
completed the required Aegis training on 6/7/2024 and
6/12/2024, Staff 2 on 7/3/2024, 7/9/2024, and 7/12/2024,
and Staff 3 on 1/2/2024, 1/4/2024, and 1/5/2024.
• Staff 4’s personnel file: Staff 4 had one discipline on
12/14/2023 related to allowing youth access to staff laptop
and not completing incident reports prior to leaving shift.
Staff 4 completed the required Aegis training on 3/6/2024.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as Staff 1 and Staff 2 were
pulling Youth A’s arms when attempting to get Youth A into the
restraint and Staff 1 pushed Youth A into his bedroom upon
releasing Youth A from the escort hold per video footage.
9

The facility is found in noncompliance as per interviews with Youth
C, Staff 4, and Staff 5, Staff 4 did slap Youth C in the face with her
hand when Youth C bite her.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical assistance was offered for the facility to address how
staff are to manage youth bites in policy/procedure per the
facilities approved restraint model technique.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR2024C0001099SI dated 2/21/2024, CAP Approved 2/26/2024
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abused including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background, appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats, ridicule,
or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff member is making inappropriate comments about a youth's
weight.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
9/23/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A
reported Staff 2 called him a “fat ass” and “chunky” on Tuesday or
Wednesday. Youth A reported Staff 2 came to his bedroom door
and told him to “shut up fat ass”. Youth A reported Youth B heard
Staff 2 say this to him. Youth A reported Staff 2 has told Youth B
“not to pee the bed”. Youth A reported Staff 6 called him a “punk”
a few days ago. Youth A reported Staff 6 told him that part of the
restraint is for staff to hold the youth’s arm and bend it and that
restraints are meant to hurt. Youth A reported no other staff or
youth heard Staff 6 tell him restraints are supposed to hurt.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
9/23/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B
reported he has never heard any staff, including Staff 2 or Staff 6,
call any youth names or say restraints are meant to hurt. Youth B
never heard Staff 2 call Youth A “fat ass”. Youth B reported Staff
2 did tell him not to try to pee himself one night in an encouraging
10

way as Youth B reported he sometimes has issues with
bedwetting.
Youth C and Youth D were interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 9/23/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker,
separately. Youth C and Youth D reported they have never heard
any staff call youth names at the facility.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
9/23/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1
reported he has never heard any staff call any of the youth at the
facility names. Staff 1 has never heard any of the staff tell youth
that restraints are supposed to hurt.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
9/23/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 denied
calling Youth A “fat ass” or “chunky”. Staff 2 denied making a
statement to Youth B about bed wetting. Staff 2 reported he has
talked to Youth B about bed wetting and given encouraging
statements. Staff 2 denied telling Youth B “not to wet the bed”.
Staff 2 has never heard any staff at the facility call youth names or
make comments that are inappropriate.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on 10/4/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported he has
never heard any staff call youth names at the facility including any
staff ever call Youth A “fat ass” or “chunky”.
Staff 5 was interviewed via telephone on 9/26/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 5 denied ever hearing
any staff call any youth at the facility names or make any
inappropriate comments.
Staff 6 was interviewed via telephone on 9/26/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 6 reported he has
never called Youth A “punk”. Staff 6 has never heard any staff at
the facility call youth names including “fat ass”. Staff 6 reported he
never has told any youth at the facility that restraints are supposed
to hurt, nor has he heard any other staff tell any youth this.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
9/23/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor 1
reported he is not aware of any concerns of staff calling the youth
names including Staff 2 calling Youth A “fat ass” or “chunky”.
Supervisor 1 is not aware of Staff 6 or any staff telling youth that
restraints are supposed to hurt.
11

Therapist was interviewed via telephone on 9/26/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Therapist reported Youth A
has not told her any concerns regarding any staff calling him
names. Therapist reported she has not heard any staff call or
tease any youth at the facility.
Documents Reviewed:
• Eagle Village Residential Services Policies and Procedures
Behavior Support and Management: Unacceptable
Discipline Practices includes verbal abuse of a youth by
staff.
• Staff 2’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record for
Staff 2. Staff 2 completed values training on 7/2/2024.
• Staff 6’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record for
Staff 6. Staff 6 completed values training on 7/12/2023, and
Culture of Care training 6/5/2024.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as Youth A is the only youth
reporting concerns of name calling. Youth B, Youth C, Youth D
and staff interviewed denied staff calling youth names at the
facility.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Health services; policies and procedures.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(g) Methods for dispensing medication when the resident will be
off site.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth's insulin pen malfunction on off grounds at quest and a new
insulin pen was not obtained prior to returning to the facility the
next day.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed via telephone on 9/26/2024. Youth A
reported while on quest he became upset and threw his insulin
pen in the dirt. Youth A could not recall what day or time this
occurred while on quest. Youth A reported his insulin pen worked
a few times after he threw it but then was jammed. Youth A
reported there were two lunches he was unable to eat due to his
insulin pen not working. Youth A reported he was upset the last
night of quest over his night snack. Youth A reported he did not
want to talk about it however Youth A stated he was able to have
12

a low carb snack. Youth A reported he did have breakfast the last
morning as he had McDonalds.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
9/23/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1
reported while at quest, Youth A was escalated and threw his
insulin pen against a tree causing the insulin pen not to function
properly. Youth A was upset that a new insulin pen was not
immediately bought out to him at quest. Staff 1 reported Youth A
threw the insulin pen around 5pm on the last full day of quest.
Youth A had the insulin pen as he was about to get insulin for
dinner time. Staff 1 reported Youth A is on two types of insulin,
and it was Youth A’s fast acting insulin pen. Staff 1 reported
Youth A was unable to have his night snack or breakfast due to
not having the insulin pen as it would not work. Staff 1 reported
Youth A received his insulin the next morning when they returned
to the facility around 11am.
Staff 5 was interviewed via telephone on 9/26/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 5 reported she was
present at quest. Staff 5 reported on Thursday or Friday Youth A
got upset and threw his fast-acting insulin pen in the woods
causing damage to the top of the pen. Staff 5 reported the result
of the throwing the insulin pen caused it to jam. Staff 5 reported
the insulin pen was able to be fixed but could not go past 4 or 5
units. Staff 5 reported Youth A did not miss any of his insulin
shots as he did not need more than the 4 or 5 units. Staff 5
reported Youth A was still able to have a night snack as all the
night snacks were low carb snacks and would not require any
insulin. Staff 5 reported the last morning of quest Youth A did not
want to eat breakfast as it was tortilla and peanut butter and due

• Eagle Village Residential Storage of Medication: For off
campus activities medications shall be packed by unit dose
into a waterproof container which will be in the constant

Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance. The facility does not have
